projects.description: Maintaining and expanding forest cover in the South Caucasus countries are critical aspects in supporting human livelihoods, economies, carbon storage, water management and storehouses of biodiversity. The forests of the South Caucasus countries (Armenia, Azerbaijan and Georgia) lie within the Caucasus Eco-region (see Figure 1), one of the Global 200 eco-regions. projects.name: The Kigali HFC implementation plan is developed
projects.description: The Kigali HFC implementation plan (Stage I) is a strategic framework designed to support Armenia in reducing its consumption of hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), potent greenhouse gases used in refrigeration and air conditioning. By adhering to the plan, Armenia aims to achieve a 10% reduction from its HFC baseline consumption by January 1, 2029.
